benchmark_details.name: VoiceAssistant-Eval
benchmark_details.overview: VoiceAssistant-Eval is a comprehensive benchmark designed to assess AI assistants across listening, speaking, and viewing, comprising 10,497 curated examples spanning 13 task categories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the full range of capabilities of voice assistants across multiple modalities, facilitating the development of next-generation AI assistants.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: It may carry biases from the source data and design choices. The dataset may still be limited in diversity.

data.source: Diverse visual and auditory inputs extracted from 47 datasets.
data.annotation: Manual annotation and curation involving multi-stage processes for data quality.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on scorer evaluations across various dimensions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in listening, speaking, and multimodal comprehension.
methodology.validation: Validated through human evaluators and alignment testing.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Measures are in place to anonymize sensitive data during the evaluation process.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset is under an MIT license for research purposes.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Strict consent and provenance procedures are followed for dataset collection.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: In accordance with local data protection regulations.
